workflow.name: Automate peer review assignments with Sonar Pro AI & multi-channel deadline reminders
workflow.description:
## Introduction
Automate peer review assignment and grading with AI-powered evaluation. Designed for educators managing collaborative assessments efficiently.

## How It Works
Webhook receives assignments, distributes them, AI generates review rubrics, emails reviewers, collects responses, calculates scores, stores results, emails reports, updates dashboards, and posts analytics to Slack.

## Workflow Template
Webhook ‚Üí Store Assignment ‚Üí Distribute ‚Üí Generate Review Rubric ‚Üí Notify Slack ‚Üí Email Reviewers ‚Üí Prepare Response ‚Üí Calculate Score ‚Üí Store Results ‚Üí Check Status ‚Üí Generate Report ‚Üí Email Report ‚Üí Update Dashboard ‚Üí Analytics ‚Üí Post to Slack ‚Üí Respond to Webhook
## Workflow Steps
1. Receive & Store: Webhook captures assignments, stores data.
2. Distribute & Generate: Assigns peer reviewers, AI creates rubrics.
3. Notify & Email: Alerts via Slack, sends review requests.
4. Collect & Score: Gathers responses, calculates peer scores.
5. Report & Update: Generates reports, emails results, updates dashboard.
6. Analyze & Alert: Posts analytics to Slack, confirms completion.
## Setup Instructions
1. Webhook & Storage: Configure endpoint, set up database.
2. AI Configuration: Add OpenAI key, customize rubric prompts.
3. Communication: Connect Gmail, Slack credentials.
4. Dashboard: Link analytics platform, configure metrics.
## Prerequisites
- OpenAI API key
- Gmail account
- Slack workspace
- Database or storage system
- Dashboard tool
## Use Cases
- University peer review assignments
- Corporate training evaluations
- Research paper assessments
## Customization
- Multi-round review cycles
- Custom scoring algorithms
- LMS integration (Canvas, Moodle)
## Benefits
- Eliminates manual distribution
- Ensures consistent evaluation
- Provides instant feedback and analytics

workflow.name: Sonar Pro AI Assignment Evaluation with Multi-Deadline Reminders

parameters.text:
=You are an engineering professor evaluating a student assignment. Analyze the following submission based on these ENGINEERING-SPECIFIC CRITERIA:

**Technical Accuracy (30 points)**
- Correct application of engineering principles
- Accurate calculations and formulas
- Proper units and dimensional analysis
- Valid assumptions and constraints

**Problem-Solving Methodology (25 points)**
- Systematic approach to problem decomposition
- Appropriate engineering tools/methods used
- Quality of design/analysis process
- Innovation and creativity in solutions

**Documentation & Communication (20 points)**
- Clear technical writing and explanations
- Proper engineering notation and symbols
- Quality of diagrams, schematics, or CAD drawings
- Professional formatting and organization

**Analysis & Critical Thinking (15 points)**
- Depth of analysis and interpretation
- Recognition of limitations and trade-offs
- Consideration of practical constraints
- Engineering judgment demonstrated

**Code/Implementation Quality (10 points, if applicable)**
- Code efficiency and optimization
- Proper documentation and comments
- Testing and validation approach
- Adherence to engineering standards

Assignment Content:
{{ $json.data }}

Provide a detailed evaluation with:
1. Score for each criterion (with justification)
2. Total score out of 100
3. Specific strengths identified
4. Areas for improvement with actionable feedback
5. Overall assessment summary

Format the response as structured JSON.

options.systemMessage: You are an expert engineering educator with 15+ years of experience evaluating student work across mechanical, electrical, civil, and software engineering disciplines.

assignments.value:
=**PEER EVALUATION FORM - {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.course_code }}**

Assignment: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.assignment_title }}
Student ID: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.student_id }}
Reviewer: {{ $json.peer_reviewers }}
Deadline: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.deadline }}

---

**EVALUATION CRITERIA:**

1. Technical Accuracy (0-30 points)
   - Engineering principles correctly applied?
   - Calculations accurate?
   - Units and dimensions correct?
   Score: ___/30
   Comments:

2. Problem-Solving Methodology (0-25 points)
   - Systematic approach used?
   - Appropriate tools/methods?
   - Creative solutions?
   Score: ___/25
   Comments:

3. Documentation & Communication (0-20 points)
   - Clear explanations?
   - Professional formatting?
   - Quality diagrams/drawings?
   Score: ___/20
   Comments:

4. Analysis & Critical Thinking (0-15 points)
   - Depth of analysis?
   - Trade-offs considered?
   - Engineering judgment?
   Score: ___/15
   Comments:

5. Implementation Quality (0-10 points)
   - Code/design quality?
   - Testing approach?
   - Standards compliance?
   Score: ___/10
   Comments:

---

**AI PRELIMINARY EVALUATION:**
Total Score: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.total_score }}/100

Strengths: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.ai_evaluation.strengths.join(', ') }}

Areas for Improvement: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.ai_evaluation.improvements.join(', ') }}

---

Please submit your evaluation by: {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.deadline }}
Submission Link: [Evaluation Form URL]

parameters.responseBody:
={
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Peer evaluation workflow initiated",
  "student_id": "{{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.student_id }}",
  "assignment": "{{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.assignment_title }}",
  "ai_score": {{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.total_score }},
  "peer_reviewers_notified": {{ $('Split Peer Reviewers').all().length }},
  "deadline": "{{ $('Store Evaluation Results').item.json.deadline }}"
}

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
